howToWriteCV.title: How to write your CV well

0.title: What is a CV?
0.text: Your CV is your personal presentation to the prospective employer. It needs to represent your professional profile as best as is possible by marketing you as a new asset for the company. It must be individual and customised to the vacancy you’re applying for and overall it must be convincing, because that is your ultimate aim – to convince the employer that you are the right candidate to invite for an interview!

1.title: How to do a CV?
1.text: When it comes to getting down to the basics of how to write a curriculum vitae, there are several elements that each candidate must bear in mind.

ul.0: A CV or curriculum vitae, often referred to as a resume in the US, is defined as an account of an applicant’s work experience, education and qualifications sent when applying for a job. This is a basic definition for something that must essentially provoke in the reader an urge to want to meet you, therefore learning how to write a CV for a job application must also embrace the notion of writing a story to intrigue the reader, in this case a hiring manager.
ul.1: When a candidate decides how to prepare a CV for their job search, he or she must begin by making a plan which encompasses their professional achievements, work history, education, qualities and skills that they can bring to the position and any extra qualifications that make them a suitable candidate.
ul.2: This information needs to then be presented in a descriptive but professional manner which showcases the strengths of each individual and their aptitude for the vacancy. You must approach CV writing from the perspective of your audience and treat each CV as an individual and new application, not copying and pasting the same material for every different job vacancy available.
ul.3: Research the company and the position, read up on what your duties would be and think about how you would tackle problems that might arise or how your accomplishments and skills would benefit the company you’d like to work for.

2.title: CV layout?
2.text:
It’s crucial to think carefully about your CV format when you write it. If you choose to do so from scratch you’ll have to plan carefully how to place each section, creating a layout which is easy on the eyes, making good use of white space and not cluttering the page with different fonts, sizes and typefaces.

It is essential to make a CV with a well-structured format that is visually pleasing and will attract the reader to the important information.br

Readability is an element to be considered when structuring a CV. This means maintaining an easy-to-read document which is well constructed and using a layout that is comfortable for the employer to navigate to find the relevant information.

When considering the CV structure, candidates should be mindful of the margins and white space on the page as well as font sizing and types, never using more than 2 fonts in the whole document. Also should not be overused or the CV becomes overcrowded.

The possibility we recommend you to ensure an HR-approved CV layout is by using our unique tools and templates which are ready-made and will save you tremendous time and energy. Our CV templates simply allow you to introduce your information so as to avoid the need to learn about the best designs for your preferred position and in what order you should place each section, etc.
Our unique tools and templates are simply the most efficient available !

3.title: How long should my CV be?
3.text:
When it comes to deciding on the perfect length for a CV, employers and HR experts differ greatly as it can depend on the applicant, their level of experience and even the industry or role they’re applying for.

However, as a general rule, the ideal length of a CV is 1-2 A4 pages to contain all of the relevant information you need to include in your job application

There are those who say that even 3 pages is acceptable in many cases but as relevance is the key to a successful CV, if you find you are padding out sections or adding information that is neither pertinent or useful, you should stick to the universal less is more rule!

In certain professions, it is likely that the job application requires extra information such as a portfolio in artistic pursuits or academic occupations however this information can also be added as a separate attachment to the curriculum vitae and need not be an integral part taking up valuable CV space.

It is advisable always to maintain each section as brief and clear as possible without missing out vital details or keywords whilst avoiding long paragraphs or endless lists as these often put employers off.

If there is a specific achievement or experience you wish to embellish on, you can use your professional cover letter which should always accompany your job application to do so.

In a cover letter the candidate has the opportunity to give further explanations or details which could convince the hiring manager to add your name to the interview list.

4.title: What not to include on a CV?
4.text: Once you’ve learnt how to write a good CV with our unique tools and templates you still need to make sure you don’t make any critical errors which is when you must consider what NOT to include in a CV before sending off your application.
4.text2:
Any additional information that a candidate sees as significant to include in a CV but doesn’t fit or it requires further elaboration, can be added to a cover letter where applicants can explain in more details the fundamental reasons why their experience and qualifications make them the ideal candidate.

We wish you every success in your job search!

ul.0: In a European CV you may find it is common to include a photo however this is strictly a NO-NO in a British, American or Canadian CV.
ul.1: Also in a CV for some companies, there is no need to include any personal details such as date of birth, age, marital status etc. as this can be seen as discriminatory. Simply check with your potential employer their internal regulations about this point.
ul.2: You are only recommended to include your citizenship if you require a working visa which is connected to your national ID.
ul.3: Try to steer clear of using cliché phrases and certain words that have been overdone in applications in the past.
ul.4: Also due to the importance of maintaining relevant information throughout, it is vital that you remove any unnecessary details or qualifications, skills or experience which do not relate to the position or provide evidence of your aptitude for the role.
ul.5: Finally, as CVs evolve and the HR community changes, you are advised not to include references on your CV at any point unless strictly requested by the job vacancy. In some cases candidates can choose to add a line at the end of the CV to mention that ‘references are available on request’.

1.title: How long does it take?
1.text:
Minutes!
Really, minutes!
With our unique tools, you will create your efficient CV in no time!

2.title: Can I make a break during the process?
2.text:
Yes, we store your data along the way.
You can take the time YOU WANT to search for additional data or edit it peacefully.
You can even start today and finish it tomorrow, all your data will be saved to offer you the best flexibility.

3.title: Can I easily change my template?
3.text:
Yes!
At any moment, you can swap for any of our other templates.
Use our tools to its fullest, try all the templates easily!

4.title: Can I make my CV on my mobile phone?
4.text:
Yes! Lots of yesses, we know! ;)
Our unique tools have been developed for all the available appliances: smartphones, tablets,
iPad, Microsoft Surfaces, desktops and laptops.
Enjoy our global technical approach!

5.title: If I have a LinkedIn profile, do I still need to make a CV?
5.text:
Yes! Unfortunately! ;)
LinkedIn is a useful tool, but it doesn’t offer the same value during the recruitment process.
Whether applying via LinkedIn or other job vacancy platforms, recruiters will still ask for a digital copy of your work history, education, skills in one place to be able to refer to it during the selection process.
LinkedIn is simply a solid plus to add in your CV, this is why all our templates allow you to add your LinkedIn account.

6.title: Are your tools safe?
6.text:
Yes, our tools have been tested on all platforms with success!
They are secures with the SSL https encrypted protocol.

7.title: Are your tools private?
7.text:
Yes, our tools are 100% private.
Your personal data is strictly protected.
No one can consult them!

8.title: Do I need to layout myself my CV?
8.text:
No!
We have done all the work for you!
Our professionally designed CV are following all the latest trends in the recruitment industry! Pick the one you prefer, fill your data, and download your PDF.
Yes, it’s that easy!

9.title: How long should your CV be?
9.text:
Usually employers prefer one page over two pages.
However, as long as your CV is clear and easy to read, you can include two pages.
If your work experience is limited to fewer than 10 years, we would recommend you to use only one page. In this specific case, less is more but only with relevant and efficient info.

personal_step.title: Personal information
personal_step.text: What's the best way a company has to contact you? We suggest you include an email and phone number. Even a photo wouldn't be bad.

work_history.title: Work history
work_history.text: Employers scan your resume for 5 seconds to decide if you are suitable. We suggest that you only add jobs that make a great impression.

school_history.title: Education and Skills
school_history.subTitle: Education
school_history.text: Employers quickly scan the section on education. We take care of the formatting so that it is easy to find. Include every school, even if you are still attending or have not graduated.

skills.title: Skills

All your data is protected, being arranged on different servers.

No service interruptions, 7 days a week, every day of the year.

paymentSecure.title: Is my payment secure?
paymentSecure.description: Security is at the heart of our commercial offer, and it is also intended for transactions! Our payment solution is protected thanks to SSL encryption. Your data is therefore 100% protected.

subscriptionWork.title: How does my subscription work?
subscriptionWork.description:
We allow all new customers to take advantage of our exceptional welcome offer: 3 days for only € 3.90!
At the end of the trial period, the continuity of the service is ensured thanks to the automatic renewal of the subscription for € 39 per month.

cancelSubscription.title: How to cancel my subscription?
cancelSubscription.description:
Very simple: you have the following options to cancel your subscription:
  1. Navigate to the Dolcumento Premium user area: in the 'MY ACCOUNT' section, use the unsubscribe option. It's automatic and instant ...
  2. By email: write to us at contacts@Dolcumento.com to express your will. Your request will be considered in the two working days following receipt of your message.
  3. By phone: you can call us every day of the week from 10 to 17, to do so please go to the 'Contact us' page.

partnership.title: Let's become a partner!
partnership.description:
Our service allows you to offer your customers a quality service at an affordable price.

Do you want to offer us a collaboration?
Do you want to collaborate only in one of the sectors we deal with?
Write to us now!

pagamentoSecure.title: SECURE PAYMENT
pagamentoSecure.description:
To allow you a safe, easy and immediate purchase, we have chosen to offer you a large credit card payment panel, so you can use the following channels: Mastercard, Mastercard SecureCode, Visa, Verified by VISA.

Payment is made directly on the secure server of our banking partner, thanks to a secure connection that uses the SSL (Secure Socket Layer) encryption process, the most used and respected protocol in the world.

Also, the 'S' in the payment page address (httpS: //….) Confirms that the page you are on is well protected.

Finally, the padlock that appears at the bottom of the page or in the navigation bar (depending on the Internet browser used), ensures encrypted protection.

All this clearly and efficiently guarantees that your personal information is strictly confidential and remains fully encrypted during all stages of payment, thus avoiding any risk of any hacking.

Once your bank accepts the transaction, your order will be validated. You will then receive an email summarizing the transaction.

For more details on our security and privacy policy, we invite you to consult our General Conditions of Use and Sale, as well as our Privacy Charter, available in the corresponding sections of our Site.
